sentences: Poisil hakkasid kõrvad liikuma, et teine temast nii hästi arvab.
Kui ta kuulis komplimenti, said tema kõrvad liikuma.
Lapsed nägid magamistuba ja nende kõrvad hakkasid liikuma.
context: The word 'liiguvad' is the third person plural form of the verb 'liikuma' (to move). In this context, it refers to 'kõrvad liikuma' which means ears moving or perking up. This expression describes someone becoming very attentive and interested when they hear something that catches their attention, similar to how animals perk up their ears when curious or alert. It's commonly used when someone hears something interesting or flattering that makes them feel pleased or proud.
